title: Margaret D. Watts
text:
April 24th, 1938 - December 22nd 2024
Margaret Dorothy Watts, a 45-year resident of La Cañada Flintridge, passed away peacefully at the age of 86 at Vivante Senior Living in Newport Beach, CA on December 22nd. She was a remarkable woman whose love, kindness and commitment to family and service left an indelible mark on all who knew her. She was an amazing wife, loving mother and devoted grandmother.
Margaret was born in Tacoma, Washington on April 24th, 1938. She was the youngest of 4 sisters and sadly lost both of her parents at a young age. Her father, who owned the Graham Blueprint company which printed all of the blueprints for the naval shipyards in Seattle, passed when she was 9 years old. Her mom was left to run the family blueprint company and she passed when Margaret was 14. Margaret was raised by her dear sister Janice and her husband Jim in Gig Harbor, Washington.
Margaret met Bill Watts at San Jose State University, and they were married in Tacoma Washington on her birthday in 1959. They remained happily married for 60 years until Bills recent passing in 2019.
A passionate volunteer and community leader, Margaret dedicated most of her life to serving others. She was past President of the Huntington Hospital Guild in 1979-1980 and ran the Children’s Horse Show at the La Cañada Flintridge Riding Club to raise funds for the hospitals new prenatal unit. She also served with numerous organizations including; The Youth House, La Canada Presbyterian Church (as a deacon), gave her time to La Cañada Chamber of Commerce, The Assistance League of Flintridge, La Cañada Tournament of Roses Association,
La Cañada Voyagers Club / Seafarers, P.E.O., La Cañada Rotary Club and La Cañada Stardusters’ Club among many others. Margaret’s contributions to her community were immense, and her positive impact will be felt for years to come.
In addition to her volunteer work, Margaret was a talented realtor who made a significant impact in La Cañada Flintridge’s real estate market. Known for her intellect, integrity and dedication she earned the trust of many clients, many of whom returned to her time and again.
Throughout her life, Margaret remained devoted to her family and her faith. Her daughters Kathleen and Wendy were the light of her life. She was a deeply loving and involved grandmother to her grandson Will. Margaret’s warmth, generosity and unwavering support for her loved ones, as well as her deep devotion to God, were at the heart of everything she did. Her legacy is one of compassion, love, strength and integrity. She will be deeply missed by all who had the privilege of knowing her.
Margaret is survived by her two children Kathleen and Wendy, her grandson Will and her sons-in-law Brad and Rudy.
Celebration of Life services honoring both Margaret and Bill Watts will take place on Thursday, February 13th at 11:00 a.m. at La Cañada Presbyterian Church, 626 Foothill Blvd., La Cañada Flintridge, CA 91011.
